docs.lead_paragraph: Despite new uncertainties about the possible Russian reaction and the qualms of some NATO allies, the United States is pushing ahead with its plan to bring several former Soviet allies into NATO in 1999. NATO is to meet in December to set a date for a summit conference, now likely by July, that will announce the first countries eligible for NATO membership. Though not final, the list is expected to include Poland, Hungary and the Czech Republic, though Slovenia and Romania are making strong cases to be included, senior American officials say.

headline.main: U.S. Pushes Bigger NATO Despite Qualms on Russia

docs.abstract: US pushes ahead with plan to bring several former Soviet allies into NATO in 1999, despite new uncertainties about possible Russian reaction and qualms of some NATO allies (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Oxford Health Plans said today that it would add alternative-medicine coverage to some of its health plans, making it the first company to form a network of practitioners offering services like chiropractic and massage therapy. Oxford, which provides care to 1.4 million people in the eastern United States through health maintenance organizations and other plans, said only practitioners who met its standards would qualify to treat members.

headline.main: Oxford Health Plans to Cover Alternative Care

docs.abstract: Oxford Health Plans says it will add alternative-medicine coverage to some of its health plans, making it first company to form network of practitioners offering services like chiropractic and massage therapy (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: KAISER ALUMINUM CORP., Houston, confirmed that it had distributed an internal memo to employees saying that it planned significant cost cuts and other measures to improve profits by the end of 1997. CROSS TIMBER OIL CO., Fort Worth, an oil and gas concern, agreed to acquire producing properties in the Permian basin of West Texas for $27.5 million. The interests are owned by limited partnerships formed by the New York Life Insurance Co. and the American Exploration Co. INTEGRATED HEALTH SERVICES INC., Owings Mills, Md., a medical and rehabilitative services provider, acquired Signature Home Care Group Inc., Irving, Tex., a provider of medical equipment for home use and nurses. Financial terms were not disclosed.

docs.lead_paragraph: When Tony Catizone, 66, tried a widely used blood pressure drug, the result was disaster: His pressure soared and he had a stroke. Yet after a hospital doctor prescribed a newer drug that kept his pressure at safe levels, his mail order pharmacy, to save 30 cents a day, switched the retired Chicago city worker back to the first medication without telling the doctor. The switch was discovered by Mr. Catizone's son, Carmen, a Chicago pharmacist and an official of a national board of pharmacists, and he made sure that his father stayed with the hospital prescription. ''Luckily, I caught it,'' he said.

headline.main: Drug Substitutions Add to Discord Over Managed Care

docs.abstract: Managed care drug plans, seeking to cut costs, routinely switch patients from widely prescribed but expensive drugs to lower-priced alternatives, causing medical complications for some patients; many states allow substitutions if patented drug is replaced by generic copy, or if patient's doctor signs off; but some doctors feel pressured to give quick approval rather than spend hours fighting with HMO's; 50 million Americans are covered by restrictive drug plans under managed care; critics claim medical decisions are being dictated by deal between drug makers and health plans, though little research is available on how often sustituting one drug for another may cause harm; practice of switching prescriptions is coming under attack from American Medical Assn and pharamcist groups as potentially dangerous interference with patient care; photos; charts (L)

docs.lead_paragraph: The Quintiles Transnational Corporation, a rapidly growing drug research company that is a Wall Street favorite, said yesterday that it planned to buy Innovex Ltd. of Britain for $747.5 million in stock. Quintiles said the deal would make it the world's biggest outside supplier of research and development to pharmaceutical, medical device and biotechnology companies.

headline.main: High-Flying Quintiles to Buy Innovex in $747.5 Million Deal
